snippet: Mason, whose muscular play and fearsome court persona helped the Knicks reach the N.B.A. finals in 1994, was an unlikely success story.
abstract: Anthony Mason, bellicose forward who played for six teams in 13 NBA seasons and whose aggressive style of play helped propel the New York Knicks to the 1994 National Basketball Association finals, dies at age 48.
lead_paragraph: Mason, whose muscular play and fearsome court persona helped the Knicks reach the N.B.A. finals in 1994, was an unlikely success story.

headline.main: Anthony Mason, Bruising Knicks Forward in the ‘90s, Dies at 48
headline.print_headline: Anthony Mason, Bruising Knicks Forward, Dies at 48
